Lets start off by saying, this certainly is one of my favourite shooter experiences of this year, i have many reasons but no doubt the best thing about this game is the innovative features it brings into the shooter medium, i've played many games like this in the past but none of them have quite caught my eye, the default settings need some tuning, but after you get past that the multiplayer is great, i think the gun mechanics are really great, in my opinion there isn't enough ammo, but thats up to preference. I haven't experienced much lag, which is really important for a game like this, so what can i say besides good job?

Everyone having a lot of hp might deter some players from enjoying the game as much, but its a different unique experience from games like, (for example) Counter Strike. I'd say some of the characters might be a bit overpowered on certain maps but that usually works fine, after all its generally skill vs skill.

Some of the unlockables might take too long to get, and i understand the people who are very dissapointed by this, especially since you can pay to unlock them earlier. The game isn't pay to win, though, which while good is just a standard.

Although some of the weapons, especially the shotguns and automatics can feel a bit frustrating, if you play enough to learn most of the cover mechanics, you can usually learn how to counter them. 

The PVE gamemode is somewhat interesting, with its large upgrade system, somewhat reminds me of the Mann VS Machine gamemode from Team Fortress 2, its not something to play the game FOR, but it certainly can be fun if you bring friends.

Pretty much nobody plays Payload or Capture The Flag, which even though rather unfortunate, i can see the reasoning for, the game feels much more right played in settings such as 1v1 or deathmatch.

Overall, this game is a solid 8/10 for me, the mechanics carry it, despite some of the weaker aspects.
I highly reccomend you to try it for yourself, its something that no person who enjoys shooters should miss.

My son got this game for Penismass in 2012 from his mother, so we installed it on his lapcock and he started wanking. By the end of the day he had 3000 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my big fat greasy balls, as they are always out in public. So I decided to make a Steam account and bake some bread to see if I could maybe play alongside Jeffs' mom. I loaded into the game, came, and started nutting but I was stuck on my huge penis. I asked Joe and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the sexiest time I had spent with my balls since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my closer again and now we actually spend time together  and outside the house together as well. Also modding support is fantastic, there is many QOL and content mods to shake the game up and improve upon it. Also, Klei themselves have been hard at work updating the game, I'm always eagerly anticipating the next content drop!

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

My wife bought this for me so that we can play it together. Right now, we play in our own server with just the 2 of us and I have to say that the first few runs were very painful and not enjoyable at all, BUT that quickly changed. The more we learned about the game, the more we played, the longer we got to survive with each run. Teamwork is key here and it's important to gather resources in preparation for the next season (or you're screwed, lol). One of the most enjoyable things about this game is definitely learning new things and building a fort. There's also something very therapeutic about gathering resources - from picking up items from the ground to gathering twigs. I could do all day. I have to say though that each run gets longer and longer. The more you learn, the longer you survive; therefore the longer your runs get. Some of our runs can go for as long as 4 hours. It's actually crazy how addicting this game is. I highly recommend it. If you can run a server with 5 friends, you're gold. Enjoy the game!

The game is very well made and has both style and substance for those with the patience to master it. That is not me!
 
I can't say I find the "not starving" (exploring, scavanging, crafting, fighting, base building) apect all that enjoyable. It's very trial and error with punishing difficulity. That's not really an issue but I wouldn't call it "fun" so there's nothing beyond the art and character that keeps me coming back. I love Wurt, her personality and unique perks but that doesn't hold much water in the long-run, sadly...

I don't really enjoy the fundamentals like moment to moment gameplay, paper flat perspective, movement and controls so this isn't a game I will stick with. It feels like a waste of time that can be fun with friends, but any other multiplayer game would be equally or more fun.

By the time I'm in the game, almost every other player is a pro. As a beginner, almost every hostile obstacle is hard; the bosses, weird weather events. The skill gap between me and everyone else is just huge. But there's something about overcoming obstacles ending up giving you satisfaction in this game. You have to craft various items and plan ahead for every events as well as seasons. To succeed in doing these, one have to explore the entire map, collecting all the necessary resources. The thing is, the game has no tutorial whatsoever, so you have to learn through harsh and brutal experience. Or, you can find guides available online through youtube or wiki. I mostly depend on the latter, but still I am having hard time surviving past any boss spawn. The greatest aspect of the game though is sharing these experience with friends or good online people. If you play with fellow players it felt like the whole group is going against the world together. The sense of cooperation, doing different things to fulfil each other's need feel just so wholesome. The bad part is, there is a category of bad players called griefers who just sabotage your base and your group. Some of them pretend to be friendly and asking where your base is, and turns out they brought bosses to your base without any of you being ready or just burn everything down. And not everybody is welcoming of other player, making it lonely for me sometimes in my own server cuz I got nobody wants to play with me sometimes. Overall, one of the best game I have ever played. 8/10 rating

I've put about 30hrs into Don't Starve Together and maybe another 10 into Don't Starve. The game does such a shit job of explaining well... ANYTHING. I get that some of the fun might come from learning but let's be real.. this is not a noob friendly game. Is the draw for most of you that there is secret knowledge that must be obtained through the wiki? Take say.. idk Subnautica or Valheim. Conan Exiles.. ANY other survival crafting game. Things might not be explained in the best way and there are things for you to figure out.. but you can manage just by playing and learning.

In DS/DST I feel like its pretty much a requirement to read the wiki. Like I can't have any sort of progression unless I read a guide/wiki on it. Its to the point where the game might as well just have the wiki in an in-game browser. Everything is just so obscure and maybe that's a huge draw for others and i'm probably in the minority here because the game has such great reviews and everyone seems to love it, etc etc.. but when does the game actually become fun? is the fun just reading the wiki and/or doing what guides say to do? If so.. why? why would having to follow a guide and do exactly what it wants you to do be fun? The game feels like work and that's about it. I guess it just isn't clicking for me.

The tim burton-esque art style is what drew me in to this game and I want to like it but I just seem to not be able to. I'd say i've given it a very fair try with around 40hrs and have played with friends, etc.. but really.. WHAT is it about this game that everyone seems to love?

ALSO: The combat is downright atrocious.. if you can even call it combat. Kiting is the only way of fighting? who thought that was a good idea? Sure you could just stand there and fight like normal with armor on, but to do that would be gimping yourself.

My playtime looks short but I have played about 12.8 hours counting the original Don't Starve and I have learned that you die a lot in this game. It's fun playing with people online and it's worth trying out if you like survival games

I am a 52 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my son, who is now 14. My son recently downloaded Don't Starve Together and in less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours. This was terrible for me, as it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching videos on Tiktok. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. Let me start off by saying while I love this game with all my heart, it's definitely not for everyone. It's not very beginner friendly for starters. It has no tutorial whatsoever and throws you in blindly to figure the mechanics out for yourself. If you're someone who doesn't enjoy using trial and error to figure out what you're supposed to do, or if you don't like the idea of needing a guide to survive your first year, this game is not for you. But those who get past the learning curve will find hours of enjoyment. 
You will find something new at every corner of the world. Tons of replayability. You will definitely get your money's worth. You'll never find yourself stuck on what to do next, because the game is always throwing things your way to keep you on your toes. There's always something to prepare for, whether its a boss being thrown your way, the harsh winters, springs, and summers, or the inevitable moment when you run out of food. 
This game definitely comes with a challenge, but don't fear if you're a player who likes to take it easy. The settings allow you to disable basically anything you want. Disable nighttime, certain seasons, certain enemies, bosses, literally anything you can think of. You can make your own fun!
Though this game is meant for multiplayer I wouldn't let that stop you if you just wanted to play on your own. Since the original singleplayer Don't Starve stopped being updated, I would still push DST your way instead since you can easily make your own private singleplayer worlds here too.
If you're a fan of survival games I could not recommend Don't Starve Together enough. 100 stars out of 10. DEFINITELY worth the price.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Such a classic game that is great to find out how well you work together with friends! Characters are charming, creatures are creative, and you can choose to have a relaxing or stressful play through. Love the fact you can customize the world to create a more peaceful or intense experience to fit your play style, game knowledge, and provide experimentation on how other mechanics within the game work. Only thing I would like to see in future updates (or DLC) is the ability to create your own character for this survival game. Either way, this is a great game to try out if you are new to PC gaming or a long time PC gamer that everyone should have in their library.
